question: Hey, did you hear about the girl who started selling homemade slime to her friends at school and now has a huge slime factory?!
Wow, really? That's so cool! She must be having a blast making and selling all that slime!
My cousin started a business where he designs and sells custom superhero capes for pets! Can you imagine your dog wearing a cape?
Haha, that's hilarious! I bet all the pets feel super powerful in their new capes!
You know what's a crazy idea? Opening a restaurant that only serves peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, but with tons of different flavors and combinations!
Oh, that's so wacky! I'd love to try a PB&J with marshmallows and sprinkles!
Imagine if there was only one pizza place in town and everybody wanted pizza all the time!
Oh, that pizza place would be super busy! They'd probably have to make more pizzas or raise the price so people would buy less.
Did you know my older brother made his own lemonade stand and sold lemonade for $1 a cup?
Cool! But how much did he spend on lemons, sugar, and cups? If he spent less, then he's making a profit!
So, my friend started selling her handmade bracelets for $5 each, and she sold 20 of them!
That's great! She made $100! That's her total revenue from selling the bracelets.
I heard a story about a guy who made a robot that could paint pictures, but the robot parts were super expensive!
Yikes! He'll have to figure out how to sell those paintings for enough money to cover the costs of building the robot!
My aunt created a new candy that turns your tongue different colors, but only kids like it!
That's fun! So her target market is kids who love trying new, colorful candies.
Did you see the billboard with the giant ice cream cone on it? It made me want ice cream so bad!
Yeah! That's called marketing! They're trying to get you excited about buying their ice cream.
There are two new toy stores in town! One has robots and the other has dinosaurs!
Ooh, they're competing to be the coolest toy store! I can't decide which one I like more!
Imagine if there was only one ice cream shop in the whole world, and they decided what flavors we could have!
That would be a monopoly! We'd have no choice but to eat whatever ice cream flavors they gave us!
I went to a store where you can buy a toy for $1, but if you buy 5, they're only 50 cents each!
That's a smart pricing strategy! It makes people want to buy more toys so they can save money!
My sister wants to open a bakery that sells only the most gigantic cookies you've ever seen!
She should make a business plan! It'll help her figure out how to make and sell those huge cookies!
My neighbor started selling homemade birdhouses, but she has so many in her garage that she can't find her car!
Sounds like she needs to organize her inventory! She should find a better way to store all those birdhouses.
I heard that when you run a business, you need to keep track of all the money you make and spend!
That's called accounting! It helps you know if your business is doing well or if you need to make changes.
My mom wants to open a store that sells fancy hats, but she can't spend too much money on it.
She'll need to make a budget! That'll help her figure out how much she can spend on things like hat materials, rent, and advertising without going broke.
I started a dog walking business, but I don't get paid until the end of the month. I need to buy more dog treats now!
You've got a cash flow problem! You need enough money coming in regularly to cover your expenses, like buying treats for the dogs.
My cousin makes and sells his own comic books, but now he's making so many that the cost to print each one is going down!
That's called economies of scale! When you produce more, the cost per item can decrease, making it cheaper for him to make each comic book.
Hey, did you notice that when everyone wanted fidget spinners, the stores sold them for high prices?
Yeah, but when the craze died down, the prices dropped! It's like a seesaw of supply and demand.
I sold lemonade for $1 a cup, but it only cost me 50 cents to make each one. I made some extra cash!
Sweet! You made a profit from your lemonade stand. You're a little money-maker!
My brother's selling custom stickers, and he's made $200 so far!
Wow, that's his total revenue! I bet he's enjoying his sticker success.
I want to sell cookies, but I need to buy ingredients and bake them first.
True! Those are your costs. Just make sure you sell your cookies for more than it costs to make them.
I noticed that everyone at school wants cool pencil cases. Maybe I should sell some!
Great idea! You found a market for your product. Time to get creative with your pencil cases!
I created a poster with pictures of my delicious cupcakes and put it up at school.
Nice! That's marketing. You're showing off your cupcakes so people know where to buy them.
I sell ice cream, but so does the shop down the street. They've got wacky flavors!
Sounds like competition! Time to step up your ice cream game and create some amazing flavors too.
My friend is the only one selling those super rare collectible cards in town.
Oh, so they've got a monopoly on those cards! They must be doing well with no competition.
I sell my handmade bracelets for $5 each, but if you buy 3, you get them for $12!
That's a clever pricing strategy! You're encouraging people to buy more at a discounted price.
I want to start a pet-sitting business, so I made a list of everything I need and how I'll get clients.
Sounds like a solid business plan! You're well on your way to pet-sitting success.
I have 20 handmade keychains ready to sell at the school fair.
That's your inventory! You're all stocked up and ready to sell.
My dad helped me track my earnings and expenses for my dog walking business.
That's great! You're learning accounting and keeping your business finances organized.
My little snack shop is doing great! I have money coming in from sales and going out for restocking.
Sounds like your cash flow is positive! Keep the snacks flowing and the money rolling in!
I just sold enough lemonade to cover all my costs for making it!
Awesome! You've reached your break-even point. Now you can start making a profit!
I always make sure to say thank you and ask if they want more ketchup at my hot dog stand.
You've got great customer service skills! Happy customers are more likely to come back.
My sister helps me run our bracelet business, and I make sure she gets her fair share of the earnings.
Nice teamwork! You're managing your human resources well, and that's important in any business.
I met a kid who sells homemade candles, and we're going to promote each other's products!
That's smart networking! Working together can help both of your businesses grow.
I started selling my homemade slime online, and now I have customers all over the world!
Wow, your business is going global! That's a great example of globalization in action.
I just started a business where I dress up as a superhero and walk dogs. It's so much fun!
That's so cool! You're a true entrepreneur, creating a unique service that combines your passions!
I sold all my cookies at school today, and everyone wants more!
Wow, the demand is high! You better bake more cookies to keep up with the supply!
My friend started a lemonade stand too, and now we're both trying to see who can sell the most.
Ooh, that's some friendly competition! It'll keep you both on your toes and make your businesses better!
